definition: Qidan or Khitan, ethnic group in ancient China, a branch of the Eastern Hu people inhabiting the valley of the Xar Murun River in the upper reaches of the Liao River 遼河|辽河[Liao2 He2]
to carve/carved words/to agree/a contract/a deed

sentences.english: Tang dynasty is an important period in Qidan's history.
sentences.chinese: 唐朝是契丹民族發展史上一個重要歷史時期。

sentences.english: The word Qita in the Korean language means China, which is a sound translation of Khitan, an ancient nationality in China.
sentences.chinese: 乞大是契丹的另一種音譯，在這裏指稱中國。

sentences.english: The Chi-tan great families were closely related with the families?polarization of the tribe union period.
sentences.chinese: 契丹世家大族與部落聯盟時期的家族分化密切相關。

sentences.english: What was in the dispatch sent by the Khitans?
sentences.chinese: 契丹的國書上是怎麼說來着？

sentences.english: The studies on Qidan arts should also show concern for the protection of Qidan art heritage.
sentences.chinese: 契丹藝術研究還應與契丹藝術遺產的保護結合起來。

sentences.english: The studies on Qidan arts should also show concern for the protection of Qidan art heritage.
sentences.chinese: 契丹藝術研究還應與契丹藝術遺產的保護結合起來。

sentences.english: My research has turned to deciphering Khitan characters.
sentences.chinese: 我的研究方向轉到了契丹文字釋讀方面。

sentences.english: The Primogenitor of Khitan, Jishou, whose story came down from generation to generation in Khitans, is a character who actually existed in history.
sentences.chinese: 契丹人口碑相傳的始祖奇首是一個真實的歷史人物。

sentences.english: Qidan nationality is one of the ancient nationalities in Northern China.
sentences.chinese: 契丹族是我國北方古老的民族之一。

sentences.english: In which case, I shall not reach Khitan.
sentences.chinese: 這麼說，我到不了契丹了。

sentences.english: We are 350 miles past the province of Yu the Khitan boarder is just ahead.
sentences.chinese: 已過幽州三百五十里，前面就是契丹的地界了。

sentences.english: He is too emotional. He may offend the Khitan Khan.
sentences.chinese: 他容易衝動，會得罪契丹可汗。

sentences.english: Qidan nations was a minority in the north of our country.
sentences.chinese: 契丹民族曾是中國北方的一個少數民族。

sentences.english: The Qidan ethnic dress has benn changing constantly, which produces profound impact on the social life of the Qidan ethnic poeple.
sentences.chinese: 服飾文化的演變對契丹社會生活也產生了深遠的影響。

sentences.english: Dalian is the Khitan tribe who live.
sentences.chinese: 大連是契丹族曾生活的地方。

sentences.english: Third, is the Khidan as the main body of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 三是以契丹爲主體的通貢情況。

definition: Tangut branch of the Qiang 羌 ethnic group/ancient ethnic group who made up the Xixia dynasty 西夏 1038-1227
Huihu, Tang dynasty name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur 維吾爾|维吾尔[Wei2 wu2 er3]
Western Xia dynasty 1038-1227 of Tangut people 黨項|党项 occupying modern Ningxia and parts of Gansu and Shaanxi, overthrown by Mongols
Jurchen, a Tungus ethnic group, predecessor of the Manchu ethnic group who founded the Later Jin Dynasty 後金|后金[Hou4 Jin1] and Qing Dynasty
Huihe, pre-Tang name of ethnic group corresponding to modern Uighur
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
Tubo or Tufan, old name for Tibet/the Tibetan Tubo dynasty 7th-11th century AD/also pr. [Tu3 fan1]
Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
Yollig Taxin or Yelü Dashi (1087-1143), Chinese-educated Khitan leader, founder of Western Liao 西遼|西辽 in Central Asia
Tartar (various northern tribes in ancient China)/Tatar (Turkic ethnic group in central Asia)
